intro: Blepharis kassneri, commonly known as the narrowleaf starburry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Blepharis kassneri is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
